pullrequest.title: Generalized Optitrack for different project files

content.raw: @caguero  and I tested this on beefy, by first merging `bridge_adding_markers` into this branch and committing the result as `optitrack_2_plus_bridge_adding_markers`.  It more or less works, but there seems to be some bug in the handling of the coordinate axes.  Apparently axis-aligned motion the real world results in movement along multiple axes in the display.  That issue needs to be debugged before we can merge this change.  For now, we'll keep running with the old `haptix_osrf.ttp` file, using the ground-plane-attached monitor tracker and our old tracker names.
content.html: @caguero and I tested this on beefy, by first merging bridge_adding_markers into this branch and committing the result as optitrack_2_plus_bridge_adding_markers. It more or less works, but there seems to be some bug in the handling of the coordinate axes. Apparently axis-aligned motion the real world results in movement along multiple axes in the display. That issue needs to be debugged before we can merge this change. For now, we'll keep running with the old haptix_osrf.ttp file, using the ground-plane-attached monitor tracker and our old tracker names.
